attributes.action: Clamp down on sexual harassment in clubs with nationally enforced regulations
attributes.background: Sexual harassment is an endemic issue faced by women on nights out in this country. It is disgraceful in 2018 that persistent unwanted attention and groping are just part of going out for women. Clubs and live music venues must appoint trained staff inside their premises to combat this issue
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is either existing staff are redistributed or new bouncers appointed to monitor the inside of the clubs. These bouncers would be easily visible so women can report any perpetuators without trouble and feel more safe and comfortable on nights out. Funding required in some cases could be provided by the government

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections
attributes.background: Under our present electoral system the distribution of seats among the political parties bears no close relation to the total votes cast for those parties. In 2017, the average number of votes cast nationally for each party varied between just under 28,000 and over 525,000 votes per seat won.
attributes.additional_details:
This is unfair and unsustainable: since 2005 two general elections have produced no overall majority, and two have produced majorities which each resulted from just over one third of the votes cast.
20 years ago the Jenkins Commission recommended a proportional system to replace First Past the Post. A 2011 referendum offered instead the AV system which Jenkins had rejected as it is not proportional.
We therefore call upon Parliament to hold a referendum on the Jenkins Commission recommendation.

attributes.action: Stop Councils charging disabled people for the cost of care and support at home
attributes.background: I am 23 years old. I have profound Learning Difficulties with complex health needs. Currently, I live at home with my mum and dad who provide a roof over my head, saving the government a huge amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: The councils are using the term Fairer Contribution Financial Assessment for Social Care to charge disabled people extra money to balance their books. This is an indirect cut to my benefits as well as to my care package. The main principles of the Care Act are well- being, these charges are going to impact on health.

attributes.action: Ban non recyclable plastic food pouches used for some pet foods, baby foods, etc
attributes.background: Plastic pouches are classified as laminated plastic & are not recyclable so they are arguably even worse for the environment than plastic bottles as there is no option but to put them into landfill.  There are many other packaging alternatives for the products using pouches, they should be banned.

attributes.action: A scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages
attributes.background:
My petition:

A new petition calling on the Government to set up a scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages.
attributes.additional_details:
I find it terrible that people can’t get on the housing ladder. People can pay more in rent than others do who pay a mortgage. Let’s make it law that the Government set up a scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages to people who it can be shown can afford the monthy mortgage payment.

Governments under all colours have failed those who want to aspire to provide a loving and constant home environment for their children.

attributes.action: Student healthcare professionals to earn apprenticeship wage during placement.
attributes.background: Student healthcare professionals are under the equivalent pressure that all registered NHS professionals are, if not more as they have to cope with living costs, studying and handling all of the stress that the NHS has to offer at the age of 18+. This could be student paramedics, nurses, doctors etc
attributes.additional_details: Although students are not yet qualified they work just as hard and put in an immense amount of effort to gain their degree to practice. We take for granted the NHS and all those that work for it so let’s make a change and make it worthwhile and easier for those aspiring healthcare professionals.

attributes.action: Introduce laws to stop the sale of knives from easily viewable display cases.
attributes.background: With the increase of knife attacks across the UK. We are asking for tighter laws controlling the sale of knives from display cases. Knifes should be sold from covered cabinets. You can't buy cigarettes from open displays due to the impact on health. We should treat the sale of knives the same way.
attributes.additional_details: Open and easily viewable cases that display knives are showing them as glamour items. They show knives and advertise them as exciting accessible items. Take a store in Sheffield that is displaying knives like the USMC Ka-bar. This is clearly a military knife. If knives are not on display and are not easily viewed, accessible or advertised in a glamorous ways. People that use them genuine reasons will have to ask for them. This allows for retailers to question their legitimate use and purpose.

attributes.action: Ban Concentrated Animal feeding Operations (CAFO) in the UK
attributes.background: CAFOs are common in the US, but are now beginning to appear in the UK. These huge industrial farms are inhumane and should not be allowed in this country. We believe they should be banned on animal welfare grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/29/revealed-industrial-scale-beef-farming-comes-to-the-uk

https://www.thebureauinvestigates.com/stories/2017-07-17/intensive-numbers-of-intensive-farming

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/the-controversial-mega-dairies-that-alarm-campaigners-and-divide-a-struggling-sector-of-british-a6744511.html%3famp

www.telegraph.co.uk/pets/news-features/does-uk-really-want-mega-farms/amp/

attributes.action: Provide gym access to all who make national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: Our wonderful NHS is under constant pressure to provide care in our times of need. Targeting healthier living whilst we are able, our times of need may reduce. Some of the costs to becoming healthier should be eradicated and the emphasis placed on exercise becoming an expectation in adult life.
attributes.additional_details: I propose government funded gyms to all who make national insurance contributions. With funds contributed between employer, employee and government. Health is just as important as your pension, and an investment into personal health can only pay us all back. There are many reasons exercise benefits our physical and mental health.

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years. 
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years. 
Car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers? 
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up.
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence, that is for a 125 again. It consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2. Then bikers have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence that again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do another module 1 and module 2 test. To prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb and taking up alot your time. It's over kill.

attributes.action: Create a regulated market for Ecstasy
attributes.background: Ecstasy a.k.a MDMA or Midomafetamine is a common class A recreational drug deeply infused within British rave and party culture. It has been used as a party drug since the 60’s. Its been illegal since 1977 but this hasnt stopped the shear number of people taking the drug.
attributes.additional_details: This has resulted in a dangerous black market where many deaths have occured due to overdose or due to what has been mixed within the drug. This petition isnt trying to condone the use of the drug but to make a safe, regulated market where if the drug is to be used it is coming from a trustworthy and controlled source. This will ultimately reduce ODs, increase knowledge and education of the drug, create tax revenue, cut out the black market AND SAVE LIVES! Please do some of your own research:)

attributes.action: Fund research into carbohydrate polymers as an alternative to plastic
attributes.background: As you are aware, in the UK we create tonnes of plastic waste daily and this is becoming an increasing problem. We need to cut down on the plastic we are using. To overcome this, we can use carbohydrate polymers (cellophane) but the problem is there is not enough funding to support research into it.

attributes.action: Require UK fashion retailers to sign up to an environmental code of ethics
attributes.background:
Companies trading in the UK should be required to source clothes responsibly.
 
To feed a culture of cheap fashion, companies are ignoring the environmental damage in developing countries.
 
Fashion is the 2nd largest global polluter. The UK is one of the largest consumers of fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC production: Stacey Dooley Investigates Fashion's Dirty Secret. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/5a1a43b5-cbae-4a42-8271-48f53b63bd07

attributes.action: All schools, by law, should have a Puffin Crossing outside the school gates.
attributes.background: Too many drivers and pedestrians in the UK have either had fatal injuries or died due to road safety. By having Puffin Crossings outside of schools, we can prevent accidents from happening outside of schools. Help us make a difference to driver's and student's experiences when using the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Too many students have sadly passed away after being hit by a car not far from their schools. Sometimes schools campaign to get a Puffin Crossing outside of the gates to prevent injuries from taking place, however they shouldn’t need to. It should be law that a Puffin Crossing is outside the school gates. Myself and two of my peers are starting this petition to not only raise awareness to road safety; we want to make a difference for students in the future.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people convicted of murder.
attributes.background: People convicted of murder should face the death penalty.

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares to anyone under 18, by law.
attributes.background: The legal age of adulthood is 18 in the UK. Yet many transport operators require children of a certain age to buy a full-fare ticket, intended for adults. Young people cannot work full-time and we should be supporting them, rather than offering fares which exploit and disadvantage children.
attributes.additional_details: Most trains in the UK are an example of how the fares system fails to support those who are in full-time education, and who are the future of our country. Fares continue to be structured as though it is the last century, when far less 16 and 17 year olds were in education. Both bus and train operators are guilty of exploiting young people, through fares and fines. A new law would create a sense of consistency and equality for all children using public transport in the UK.

attributes.action: Give EU citizens working in the NHS free indefinite leave to remain in the UK.
attributes.background:
The possibility of a "no-deal" Brexit has been described as uncomfortably high. 
There are a significant number of EU citizens working in the NHS.  Any disruption in their working rights may have catastrophic effects. The government should give them indefinite leave to remain for free.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 60,000 NHS staff who are EU citizens. At present, there is no assurance that they can continue working post Brexit. This makes recruitment of staff challenging. 
The suggested £65 fee represents more than one day's earnings for the majority of them and cannot be justified for administration purposes.

attributes.action: Ask Esther McVey to make a further statement to Parliament
attributes.background: Esther McVey's apology over her misrepresentation of the National Audit Office's report into Universal Credit does not stand up to scrutiny. She needs to further explain how she came to be using words that were the polar opposite to the report.

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance to councils on the eligibility for a disabled travel pass
attributes.background: People applying for a disabled persons pass are being asked for evidence of having had a drivers licence refused on medical grounds, even when they have never applied for a licence. This has happened to many people including myself and others with epilepsy and it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Transport Act 2000 says you are eligible if you would be refused a driving licence due to physical fitness, IF you ever applied. The practice of demanding a refusal letter is therefore not correct, as the law does not say you have to have applied for a licence. 

Some authorities now accept a doctor’s letter, but a person has to get this by appointment with a specialist, which can cost up to £200. Clear and legally binding guidance must be issued to all local authorities so that they understand what the law actually says and stop denying disabled people what they are legally entitled to.

attributes.action: Make piercing any part of a child’s body illegal under the age of 10
attributes.background: It should be illegal for children under the age of 10 to have piercings of any kind (including ears). A child who does not understand the implications of piercings should not have them. A baby or toddler cannot verbally consent and should not have holes put into their body.
attributes.additional_details: Many people grow up to have uneven ear piercings and believe they should have been able to make the choice over what happens to their own body.

attributes.action: Make pas43 a minimum legal requirement for all breakdown and recovery personnel
attributes.background: After working with various company’s doing roadside breakdowns and recovery, some of which apply pas43. The dangers of this are horrifying. I think it’s about time these guidelines were made legal as a minimum requirement to get rid of the cowboys and to reduce further risk to everyone
attributes.additional_details:
Where some company’s will use pas43 and stick to the guidelines, give staff the required training. There are still company’s out there that will send untrained staff in any vehicle to broken down vehicles which are ill equipped and have no extra reflectors or beacon. 
I have also have an email from a parliament case worker stating pas43 is not a legal requirement and is down to the company health and safety to make sure that staff know what they are doing at the roadside. This needs to change!

attributes.action: Re-introduce National Service
attributes.background: For the good of the country and it’s people, bring back National Service.

attributes.action: Ban all cold calling by phone in the UK
attributes.background: Absolutely sick and tired of cold calls - accidents, insurance, investments, PPI
attributes.additional_details: Too numerous to note and all of UK is suffering.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Ensure cyber bullying attacks both real person and fake accounts are investigated by the police and persons dealt with accordingly. Cyber bullying makes our young people and adults twice as likely to self harm. We are seeing people taking their own life because of this. Police are not preventing.

attributes.action: Fund more services to Walsall by looking at reopening old lines and stations.
attributes.background: I am writing to please ask the government to look into reopening the old lines around Walsall like the Sutton Park Line, South Staffordshire Line, Walsall-Wolverhampton Line and to please add services to Wellington, Stafford, Shropshire, Wolverhampton (Direct) and to other places in England.

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: Change Government Policy that allows Developers to destroy our Countryside
attributes.background: The current National Planning Framework Policy which dictates the requirements for housing development in the UK means developers have been given the power to force LA's to offer up a minimum of 5 yrs land supply for development putting immense pressure to offer up normally protected Greenbelt
attributes.additional_details: The 5yr land supply makes no allowance for sites that have been given approval but have yet to be developed, ie if the annual requirement for houses in a particular borough, set by government is 1000/yr, the LA must continually find sites to maintain a min. stock of 5000, regardless of whether the developers decide to build or not due to economic or other factors. Developers use this policy to build land stocks while our villages, countryside & greenbelt are being destroyed for profit/greed

attributes.action: Change the Family Law to protect non-resident parents and make contact easy.
attributes.background:
There are parents who have their kids full time, that use the kids as weapons against their ex partners, refusing contact or extra contact to the children, if certain demands are not adhered to. 
This in turn is causing suicide, mental illness, physical illness, and financial hardship.
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be a signed agreement when parents split detailing the days that the non-resident parent can see the kids. This should be done at the local council and be a document that is recognised by the court of law as a binding contract. In addition: 
• CSA should be overhauled to take into account not just the non-resident’s income, but their cost of living. 
• The 48 hour fortnight law should be changed to 53 hours, giving the leaving parent a chance to see their kids after school. An extra one day in a week during school half term should also be introduced.

attributes.action: Require cars to be impounded or crushed for leaving dogs in hot cars.
attributes.background: Unfortunately we see so many dogs left in hot cars during peak summer periods due to owners whom haven't a clue. Although social media are widely broadcasting this they still leave dogs in cars. The fear of your pride and joy being crushed may just be the wake up call they need.

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: Ban the use of flammable cladding on all buildings
attributes.background: The Grenfell Tower disaster shows clearly that the use of flammable cladding should be banned on all buildings.

attributes.action: Require restaurant food to be labelled with carbohydrate content for diabetics
attributes.background: As a type 1 diabetic I find it extremely hard to work out exactly how much insulin I need to inject when eating fast food. Guessing my insulin means I may under or over inject insulin which has a huge affect on my glucose levels.
attributes.additional_details:
Unstable glucose levels can have a huge effect on diabetics.
 
The NHS spend over £1.5m an hour on diabetes or 10% of the NHS budget. 
https://www.diabetes.co.uk/cost-of-diabetes.html
 
1 in 16 people have diabetes in the UK which is over 4 million! 
 
It’s a condition that is on the rise which impacts lives. 
 
Severe Complications can occur from poor control - Heart, liver, kidney, eye and circulation problems are just a few.

attributes.action: Review the educational system for special educational needs (SEN) students.
attributes.background: Currently I believe the system is majorly lacking. Last year my autistic brother turned 11,  The experience throughout this period in my view was discriminatory, and my impression is that this isn't an isolated case. The government should do more to expand the options for students with SEN.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone with a disability has a protected characteristic under the equality act 2010. Under s.85.292 it is unlawful for a school to discriminate or harass a child with a disability by denying admittance.
Students with SEN have a health and care plan which means schools on the plan must accept them. However this is forced upon them with little say from the family.
My brothers treatment fell foul of the law, being denied access by numerous schools. He was forced into a special needs school.

attributes.action: Require a child train fare to be ages 5-16 whilst in full time education
attributes.background: Rail companies define child fares as from age 5-15. But a 16 year old can still be at school (Year 11) and has to pay an adult fare.
attributes.additional_details: Companies cite the young person railcard however this cannot be used for morning fares, season tickets or fares under a certain cost. Student discounts aren't available until Year 12. This means that in their most important year 16 year old children and their family are facing the stress of paying double the amount. http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/times_fares/46494.aspx

attributes.action: Make all cycle paths and cycle lanes compulsory for all cyclists for safety.
attributes.background: Roads are increasingly dangerous with traffic increasing, Councils have spent millions of pounds creating cycleways which are not effectively used. Cyclists are putting their lives at risk by using the roads instead. Requiring cyclists to use cycleways, when available, should reduce fatalities.

attributes.action: Debate the government's adoption of the IHRA definition in its entirety.
attributes.background: The UK government to debate their decision to accept the IHRA definition of antisemitism in its entirety based on the observations of learned counsel & others that it is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Some people consider that the IHRA definition and the examples are poorly drafted, misleading, and could lead to the suppression of legitimate debate and freedom of expression.

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have been in UK for 7 years
attributes.background: People who lived here more than 7 years have a huge social circle. Everyone is connected to each other. Deporting these immigrants will leave a very bad impact on their familes and local community. If they are legally allowed, govt will get huge revenue in terms of income tax and national insurance.

attributes.action: Stop HMRC from referring to the UK taxpayers as their "customers"
attributes.background: HMRC, in all their publications as well as communications to individuals refers to us, the body of the Great British tax payer as "customers". This is not only misleading, but an outright mockery given the absence of choice over who and what you as a "customer" deal with.
attributes.additional_details: A customer is an individual or business that purchases the goods or services produced by a business. Attracting customers is the primary goal of most public-facing businesses, because it is the customer who creates demand for goods and services." The UK taxpayer does not create a demand for HMRC, nor do we have a choice or any consumer rights when it comes to dealing with HMRC. Therefore, HMRC must revert to using the term "taxpayer" in all their publications and communications.

attributes.action: Change the threshold for higher rate tax to at least £60,000.
attributes.background: A person earning up to £46,350 pays basic rate tax (20%). After that the tax increases to 40% for anyone earning between £46,351 and £150,000. I feel it is unfair that a person earning £43,351 per annum should be on the same rate of tax as someone earning more than three times the salary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/income-tax-rates

attributes.action: Put a Childcare Levy in place to help working families with childcare costs.
attributes.background: The majority of the existing childcare support options are income based and do not incentivise women to go back to work.  To claim and access childcare support is difficult. Even though the government spends £7.5n in childcare support per year, it only covers a fraction of families’ childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: We need a well-rounded childcare infrastructure that helps working families with childcare costs and incentive women to go back to work. We need the government to incentivise companies to offer childcare arrangements as part of their benefits umbrella. We need a Childcare Levy to cover childcare costs of working parents for children up to the age of 5. We need a register of childcarers so that parents can leave their children in safe hands. www.childcarelevy.co.uk

attributes.action: add a vegan week in secondary school food tech curriculum
attributes.background: vegan food is often considered bland and boring, but by having a vegan week people will become more educated about veganism and will have a less negative opinion about it

attributes.action: Prevent persons on the sex offenders register from running a licensed premises
attributes.background:
There are numerous licences premises being run leased and occupied by convicted sex offenders in this country. 
I have been told that this is within the law. 
In my opinion and many others this should not be allowed.

attributes.action:
Refuse to uphold the NI (Executive Formation and
Exercise of Functions) Bill.
attributes.background: This Bill will compromise democracy in NI, placing decision-making in the hands of unelected civil servants and retrospectively blocking challenges to the Secretary of State's requirement to call an election within a reasonable period of time, an important safeguard to our democratic institutions.
attributes.additional_details: Our government may be currently at a stalemate, but Parliament has no mandate from the people of Northern Ireland to revoke our democratic rights and their safeguards.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for online platforms to allow sales of CITES-protected species
attributes.background: While it's illegal to buy and sell seahorses (dead, alive, whole or in part) within Europe, online platforms flout this law by hosting adverts for their sale. Seahorses could therefore be functionally extinct in 25 - 30 years* (based on 150 million + seahorses per year taken from the sea).
attributes.additional_details:
Ref: * figures from SaveourSeahorses
 
The Seahorse Trust (www.theseahorsetrust.org) has campaigned and highlighted to each online marketplace over the last twelve + months the illegality of sales of CITES-protected seahorses, but is continually ignored. It should be illegal for these adverts to be hosted by online marketplaces.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recyclable plastic within 5 years
attributes.background: Every year in the UK we buy around 3.7 million tonnes of plastic as packaging, with only 842,000 tonnes being recycled. We as the UKs consumers find this to be unacceptable for the environment and the future of the planet.
attributes.additional_details: The government has a very complicated 25 year plan to eliminate plastic waste but they could pass a law to ban these products in our shops within 5 years or sooner. Our current government is largely sponsored by big businesses and won’t want to cause them the bother of producing alternatives which won’t destroy our precious world. However, as we elect and pay for these people to represent our wishes it is time we demanded what we want for our children’s future.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence to beg or busk with a dog in a public place
attributes.background: Chow dogs are being forced to sit in the heat for over 12 hours as the 'owner' begs for money. Gangs are breeding and importing the dogs for the use of 'entertainment ' to solicit funds. They are 'rented out', forced to urinate tied up, kept in hot vans, beaten and kicked in the head.
attributes.additional_details: Making the use of dogs and other animals for begging and busking a specific offence would make it much easier to bring the perpetrators of this sort of cruelty to justice.

attributes.action: Create a new permanent national UK bank holiday: "Bank holiday of Pride."
attributes.background: 2017 marked 50 year anniversary for decriminalization of homosexuality- all we got were apologies (some posthumously).
attributes.additional_details: 2018 marked 30 years since Section 28 Education clause was removed-again apology but couched with "it was protecting children". Now there are debates about trans issues and the Gender Recognition Act.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park across/block a private driveway
attributes.background: It seems a large oversight that people have free will to deny people the use of their own driveways by parking across with no repercussions. I myself have had multiple incidents and I’m sure many other people have also and no legal right to get the car moved. I hope to get this changed.

attributes.action: Grant Gibraltar special designated status that would keep it within the EU.
attributes.background: Political tensions have risen again over Gibraltar's status since Brexit, & without a credible answer, we could see their people suffer the consequences of leaving the EU worse than any other place in the UK's jurisdiction.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/gibraltar-brexit-northern-ireland-border-spain-theresa-may-a8234516.html
 
http://uk.businessinsider.com/why-the-tiny-territory-of-gibraltar-could-be-the-next-sticking-point-in-brexit-negotiations-2018-6
 
http://www.gibraltarolivepress.com/2016/09/12/chief-minister-fabian-picardo-says-british-means-british-at-national-day-political-rally/

attributes.action: Ensure costs for restoring order at HMP Birmingham are met by G4S not taxpayers
attributes.background: In 2011, the running of HM Prison Birmingham was entrusted to outsourcing company G4S. As G4S has failed in its responsibilities, the government should ensure that any costs associated with restoring appropriate conditions at the prison are met by the company and not by the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details:
The company’s failure to maintain order and provide a safe, habitable environment that will ensure the rehabilitation of inmates, and their return to society has been reported by HM Inspectorate of Prisons www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk and the prison has now been placed under the control of the Ministry of Justice. 
 
As G4S has been found to have failed in its duty of care to the inmates and staff alike, the Government should take all possible steps to ensure the taxpayer is not penalised for the company’s failure to meet its contractual obligations.
